Package io.github.ai4ci.abm

Interface PersonBaseline

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
@Immutable public interface PersonBaseline extends Serializable
Baseline parameters for a person in the simulation. These are parameters that are fixed for the person and do not change over the course of the simulation. They are set once during configuration but their effects may be modified by the person's behaviour through the PersonState.

These represent the core features of this individual that are unchanged and to which the person will return during the simulation.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Method Details

    • getAppUseProbability

      Double getAppUseProbability()
      How likely is this person to use an app on any given day.
      Returns:
      the baseline probability of app use for this person, which is modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of others in the network

    • getComplianceBaseline

      Double getComplianceBaseline()
      How likely is this person to comply with instructions compared to another
      Returns:
      the baseline compliance probability for this person, which is modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of others in the network

    • getDefaultBehaviourState

      State.BehaviourState getDefaultBehaviourState()
      The default behaviour state for this person. This is the state that they will revert to when not influenced by their own behaviour or the behaviours of others in the network. It is also the state that they will start in at the beginning of a simulation.
      Returns:
      the default behaviour state for this person, which is modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of others in the network

    • getMobilityBaseline

      Double getMobilityBaseline()
      A probability of contact of another person in the social network.
      Returns:
      the baseline probability of contact for this person, which is modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of others in the network

    • getSelfIsolationDepth

      Double getSelfIsolationDepth()
      The minimum mobility modifier that a person will experience. This is an odds ratio that is applied to their baseline probability
      Returns:
      the minimum mobility modifier for this person, which is applied to their baseline probability and modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of others in the network

    • getSymptomSensitivity

      Double getSymptomSensitivity()
      How likely is a this person to have no symptoms when infected
      Returns:
      the baseline probability of false negative symptoms for this person, which is modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of others in the network

    • getSymptomSpecificity

      Double getSymptomSpecificity()
      How likely is a this person to have false positive symptoms when not infected
      Returns:
      the baseline probability of false positive symptoms for this person, which is modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of others in the network
